page.title: 16GILMORTON POST OFFICE
page.content: Gilmorton Post Office Stores was built in 1880 by Mr Clayton Willey as a hotel,but it never opened as one.It then became a shop and family home.The present owner and his family came to the village from London in 1973 and has continued as a general store and post office.In the shop they try to carry as many goods as possible,including food,coal,calor gas,stationery and some hardware goods.The post office caters for the collection of mail,distribution of family allowances and old age pensions.The shop provides a useful service in communication for the village as all manner of notices are displayed in the shop window.
